intro: Coppensia paranana, commonly known as the Paraná water lily, is a aquatic plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as lakes and ponds. Its leaves are thick and waxy, helping to support the weight of the flowers and provide habitat for aquatic life. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by contributing to water quality and supporting local biodiversity.
